Package org.neo4j.io.pagecache.impl

Class SingleFilePageSwapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.io.pagecache.impl.SingleFilePageSwapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PageSwapper
    public class SingleFilePageSwapper
extends Object
implements PageSwapper
    A simple PageSwapper implementation that directs all page swapping to a single file on the file system. It additionally tracks the file size precisely, to avoid calling into the file system whenever the size of the given file is queried.

      • read

        public long read​(long filePageId,
                 long bufferAddress)
          throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: PageSwapper
        Read the page with the given filePageId, from the concrete file on the file system, into the page given by the bufferAddress and default bufferSize.

        Returns the number of bytes read in from the file. May be zero if the requested page was beyond the end of the file. If less than the file page size, then the rest of the page will contain zeros.

        Note: It is possible for the channel to be asynchronously closed while this operation is taking place. For instance, if the current thread is interrupted. If this happens, then the implementation must reopen the channel and the operation must be retried.

        Specified by:
        read in interface PageSwapper
        Throws:
        IOException

      • read

        public long read​(long filePageId,
                 long bufferAddress,
                 int bufferLength)
          throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: PageSwapper
        Read the page with the given filePageId, from the concrete file on the file system, into the page given by the bufferAddress and the bufferSize.

        Returns the number of bytes read in from the file. May be zero if the requested page was beyond the end of the file. If less than the file page size, then the rest of the page will contain zeros.

        Note: It is possible for the channel to be asynchronously closed while this operation is taking place. For instance, if the current thread is interrupted. If this happens, then the implementation must reopen the channel and the operation must be retried.

        Specified by:
        read in interface PageSwapper
        Throws:
        IOException

      • read

        public long read​(long startFilePageId,
                 long[] bufferAddresses,
                 int[] bufferLengths,
                 int length)
          throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: PageSwapper
        Read pages from the file into the pages given by the bufferAddresses, starting from the given startFilePageId.

        Returns the number of bytes read in from the file. May be zero if the requested startFilePageId was beyond the end of the file. If the file does not have enough data to fill up all the buffer space represented by the pages, then the remaining buffer space will be filled with zero bytes.

        The contents of the pages should be considered to be garbage if the operation throws an exception, since the constituent reads can be reordered, and no zeroing will take place.

        Note: It is possible for the channel to be asynchronously closed while this operation is taking place. For instance, if the current thread is interrupted. If this happens, then the implementation must reopen the channel and the operation must be retried.

        Specified by:
        read in interface PageSwapper
        Throws:
        IOException

      • write

        public long write​(long filePageId,
                  long bufferAddress)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: PageSwapper
        Write the contents of the page given by the bufferAddress and default length of page buffer, to the concrete file on the file system, at the located indicated by the given filePageId.

        Returns the number of bytes written to the file.

        Note: It is possible for the channel to be asynchronously closed while this operation is taking place. For instance, if the current thread is interrupted. If this happens, then implementation must reopen the channel and the operation must be retried.

        Specified by:
        write in interface PageSwapper
        Throws:
        IOException

      • write

        public long write​(long startFilePageId,
                  long[] bufferAddresses,
                  int[] bufferLengths,
                  int length,
                  int totalAffectedPages)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: PageSwapper
        Write the contents of the given pages, to the concrete file on the file system, starting at the location of the given startFilePageId.

        If an exception is thrown, then some of the data may have been written, and some might not. The writes may reorder and tear, so no guarantee can be made about what has been written and what has not, if an exception is thrown. Therefor, the entire write operation should be retried, in the case of failure, or the data should be rewritten through other means.

        Returns the number of bytes written to the file.

        Note: It is possible for the channel to be asynchronously closed while this operation is taking place. For instance, if the current thread is interrupted. If this happens, then implementation must reopen the channel and the operation must be retried.

        Specified by:
        write in interface PageSwapper
        Throws:
        IOException

      • tryReopen

        private void tryReopen​(ClosedChannelException closedException)
                throws ClosedChannelException
        Reopens the channel if it has been closed and the close() method on this swapper has not been called. In other words, if the channel has been "accidentally" closed by an interrupt or the like. If the channel has been explicitly closed with the PageSwapper#close() method, then this method will re-throw the passed-in exception. If the reopening of the file fails with an exception for some reason, then that exception is added as a suppressed exception to the passed in ClosedChannelException, and the CCE is then rethrown.
        Throws:
        ClosedChannelException

           throws IOException

      • truncate

        public void truncate()
              throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: PageSwapper
        Truncate the file represented by this PageSwapper, so the size of the file is zero and PageSwapper.getLastPageId() returns -1.

        Truncation may occur concurrently with writes, in which case both operations will appear to be atomic, such that either the write happens before the truncation and is lost, or the file is truncated and the write then extends the file with any zero padding and the written data.

        Specified by:
        truncate in interface PageSwapper
        Throws:
        IOException

      • canAllocate

        public boolean canAllocate()
        Specified by:
        canAllocate in interface PageSwapper
        Returns:
        true if the given page swapper implementation supports pre-allocating files.

      • allocate

        public void allocate​(long newFileSize)
              throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: PageSwapper
        Send a hint to the file system that it may reserve the given number of bytes of capacity for this file. The hope is that this might speed up future operations and reduce fragmentation.
        Specified by:
        allocate in interface PageSwapper
        Parameters:
        newFileSize - The new size of the file; following this call, the file system may anticipate to receive IOs in this range.
        Throws:
        IOException
